001package org.vafer.jdeb.utils;
002
003import java.time.Instant;
004import java.util.Optional;
005import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
006
007import org.apache.maven.archiver.MavenArchiver;
008import org.vafer.jdeb.Console;
009
010public class OutputTimestampResolver {
011    private final Console console;
012    private final EnvironmentVariablesReader envReader;
013
014    public OutputTimestampResolver(Console console) {
015        this(console, new EnvironmentVariablesReader());
016    }
017
018    OutputTimestampResolver(Console console, EnvironmentVariablesReader envReader) {
019        this.console = console;
020        this.envReader = envReader;
021    }
022
023    public Long resolveOutputTimestamp(String paramValue) {
024        if (paramValue != null) {
025            Optional<Instant> outputDate = MavenArchiver.parseBuildOutputTimestamp(paramValue);
026            if (outputDate.isPresent()) {
027                console.info("Accepted outputTimestamp parameter: " + paramValue);
028                return outputDate.get().toEpochMilli();
029            }
030        }
031
032        String sourceDate = envReader.getSourceDateEpoch();
033        if (sourceDate != null && !sourceDate.isEmpty()) {
034            try {
035                long sourceDateVal = Long.parseLong(sourceDate);
036                console.info("Accepted SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH environment variable: " + sourceDate);
037                return sourceDateVal * TimeUnit.SECONDS.toMillis(1);
038            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
039                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH environment variable value: " + sourceDate, e);
040            }
041        }
042
043        return null;
044    }
045
046    static class EnvironmentVariablesReader {
047        String getSourceDateEpoch() {
048            return System.getenv("SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH");
049        }
050    }
051}
